vague_description: The airport is trying to balance luggage capacity with pollution constraints by optimizing the number of new vehicles they buy.
detailed_description: An airport buys two types of vehicles, a 4-wheeler and 3-wheeler, to help move luggage. A 4-wheeler vehicle can move \param{CapacityFourWheeler} luggage per day and produces \param{PollutionFourWheeler} units of pollutant per day. A 3-wheeler vehicle can move \param{CapacityThreeWheeler} luggage per day and produces \param{PollutionThreeWheeler} units of pollutant per day. The airport needs to be able to move at least \param{MinLuggageCapacity} luggage per day. To avoid over-polluting the airport, they can produce at most \param{MaxPollution} units of pollutant per day. How many of each vehicle should the airport buy to minimize the total number of vehicles needed.
target_objective: Minimize the total number of vehicles purchased
target_constraints: Total luggage capacity must be at least MinLuggageCapacity per day
Total pollutant production must be at most MaxPollution units per day
target_parameters: Luggage movement capacity of a 4-wheeler vehicle per day
Pollution produced by a 4-wheeler vehicle per day
Luggage movement capacity of a 3-wheeler vehicle per day
Pollution produced by a 3-wheeler vehicle per day
Minimum total luggage movement capacity required per day
Maximum allowable pollution output per day
